data.title: Service was good, not so good food.
data.text: We were in town for a special even and had some time to spare. We got to the restaurant around 430 so restaurant not too busy. Service was good, fast and friendly but the food was just ok. Blackened chicken tacos were not blackened and the chicken was very tough. We also tried the fish tacos which were good but don't get Mexican food at this place. Go to a Authentic Restaurant not a Tavern. Spring Rolls were good. Just not quality food. Tacos were about 4$ per taco and about 4 total bites each.

data.title: Very Good, Fresh Food
data.text: Stopped in for lunch before a business meeting in Lansing. Good array of beer options.  I had a chicken salad with beets and olive tapenade that was really delicious. My partner was pretty happy with a blackened chicken sandwich and side salad. A touch pricey, but the food was worth it.  Competent service and an upscale kind of atmosphere.

data.title: Live Music + Drinks = Good Time
data.text:
Met an old work friend for drinks and it was a real bustling place.  Suits and ties all over with parties and business meetings.  Even ran into another friend who was there working the scene. Damn lobbyists!  Either way, I loved that they had different seating options.  You could belly up to the bar, grab a table, or even sit in some comfy chairs near the front.  They even had a private room in the back.
The service was good and very timely which I appreciate.  We had Rachel and she was fantastic and appreciated her diligence.
They also had live music which was good. It added to the ambiance of the place and made me want to stay.  However, too many beers can be a bad thing!

data.title: Excellent, most of the time
data.text:
Much like MidTown Brewing, Tavern on the Square benefited from the fact that my apartment was only several blocks away, and as a poor student their happy hour was hard to beat.  Oddly, even though I would stop by at least once a month, never once did I actually try any of their entrees.  For me, it was appetizers all the way.

Thankfully, one or two of their appetizers was sufficient to fill you up, especially when paired with a local micro-brew.  Oh wait, I forgot, in the midwest they are called craft beers.  So sorry.

Regardless,  Tavern on the Square seldom disappointed.  The breezy front of the tavern was perfect during the warm months, and the fireplace perfect in the winters.  It is a tavern for all seasons, and understands the clientele, hence the rotation of micro-...er, local craft beers.  The wings are basic, but good, and the tempura vegetables will stick with you, because not a lot of places do that.

One drawback, Friday and Saturday nights Tavern basically becomes a night club, and no longer a conversation-conducive pub.  Just so you know.

A good place to watch football, by the way.

data.title: Very good lunch, broad menu of food & beer on tap
data.text: We ate here after visiting the RE Olds Museum nearby and had a very good lunch at a reasonable price.  We both enjoyed a local beer (there were name brands also) along with our sandwiches and sweet potato chips.  YUM!  Parking was easy at 1:15 on a Tuesday on the street in front for <1$ in the meter.

data.title: good food.
data.text: good food.  good service.  The chips are really good and addictive.  busy at lunchtime.  lots of locals stop in as well as visiting business people

data.title: Very good food!
data.text: I work downtown and have never been to this restaurant.  We had 6 people in our group and the service was a little slow.. but they were pretty busy.  The waitress was attentive and nice.  I thought the menu selections were different which was a nice surprise.  Everyone was happy with their lunch and we will definitely return. Good place for lunch!

data.title: fine for a quick dinner or hanging out
data.text: Casual atmosphere. The food promises a little more than it delivers, let's call it pretty good pub food. Prepared well and tasty. OK selection of on-tap craft beers, selection changes. Very reasonable prices for what you get. Portions were generous.

data.title: Delicious... and everyone was enjoying themselves
data.text: I really like Tavern on the Square.  The people who go there are business during the day and some of Lansing's VIP in the night.  Since  Rebecca's arrival, I think that service has increased.  The food is great.  I have been two days in a row for personal and business.  The food is amazing.  There is a tapas menu.  I had fish tacos and they were awesome.  Since it is downtown, there is music at night.  How much fun you have will vary with the DJ selected.  They should bring John Beltran back and make sure they promote it so people will show up.  Very good sangrias too.

data.title: Not the Stop for a Burger
data.text: This was my first visit to Tavern and maybe my last.  It has the feel of a great place to hang on a Sunday afternoon.  The atmosphere is casual, the front of the restaurant opened to a street-side patio.  I order a BLT with sweet potato chips.  The sandwich was very standard, the chips a pleasant surprise.  My daughter ordered the Sunday "special," 1/2 off on a burger.  We were stunned to see the heap of neon, plastic, processed cheese!  Please skip the half off and use the real product.  This restaurant simply can't be taken seriously if McDonald's style cheese is served.

data.title: An incredible disappointment for high school students
data.text: Though I did not dine at this restaurant, I have been advised by my son, a high school sophomore, about the horrendous service they received.  Fifteen high school students, member of the Model United Nations, were given 1.5 hours for a dinner break.  The Tavern was an approved location close to where they were meeting.  Apparently they were given a waitress with a major attitude.  The President of the council informed her that they had 90 minutes for dinner as soon as they were seated.  She chose not to turn in the orders for over an hour.  As a result, the students didn't receive their food until it was time to go.  When the council president complained, the waitress threatened to have them all arrested.  This is not acceptable behavior for McDonald's, let alone a restaurant that caters to government staff.  What a poor example to set for these students who are working to solve world issues; a restaurant that can't solve a service issue with students.

data.title: Good food in a laid back place
data.text: The menu is great for a business lunch, and government peeps are always on hand--so you can get some networking done too. More laid back than Troppo and Edmund's; the food is always good and the price is fair.

data.title: Lovely Tapas
data.text: Get the filet mignon w/mash potatoes; it's a smaller portion because it's a "tappa" but who needs to get stuffed when you can relax by the al fresco fireplace and drink to your heart's content!  Nice staff, great atmosphere, popular downtown hangout.

data.title: Very nice menu, Friday evening specials, tasty food, good service, outdoor seating with our dog outside the rail.
data.text: Second visit.  Very extensive menu included less common selections.  Good selection of specials at peak time on Friday.  We were allowed to have our dog just outside the rail at the outside seating area.  Another good experience; we will return.

data.title: Good Beer, Off Night for Food?
data.text:
My wife stopped in for a beer and something light to eat, around 9pm.  The food passing by looked good but we did not want a burger or sandwich.  I ordered a chefs salad and my wife an appetizer of lettuce wraps.  The salad come out and it was wilted, not fresh greens.  My wife lettuce wraps was a bowl of sweet teriyaki sauce with chow mein noodles to dip the chicken in.  We asked for a locally brewed beer and the waitress did not know much about the beer on tap.  Suggested Great Lakes Brewery (Cleveland brewery).  
Bottom line we ordered the wrong food, should of looked at what was coming out of the kitchen and ordered the same.  Maybe they were short staffed this night but our server did not know much about the beers on tap.  
Every restaurant has a off night, think we caught it on our first visit.

data.title: 5 stars.
data.text: So my boyfriend lives in Lansing but he rarely ever gets adventurous enough to find new places to eat. So we got on urbanspoon and Tavern on the Square came up. We went on a Saturday and we had to sit at the bar to wait on a table, the place is a pretty decent size with the upstairs, but someone was having a party. I LOVED the atmosphere. The staff was really nice as well. I got the Spanish Chicken salad which was super delicious and just the right size. My boyfriend got the fish and chips and the complaint was from him, no tartar sauce. Which most people expect to get with their fish and chips but I don't think he read the menu. We also got the deep fried green beans, I think they tried to dress up the name by calling it 'tempura green beans' but it was not as light as traditional Japanese tempura I can't wait to go back.

data.title: Trendy bar and grill.
data.text: We went with our children for drinks and dinner.  It was a nice evening so we sat outside.  We had appetizers and dinner.  It was very busy but our service was good.  We were all very pleased with the appetizers and our choices of our main dinner items.  Definitely will go back.

data.title: Little Hidden Jewel downtown
data.text: I was so pleasantly surprised with this restaurant (bar and grill) from the entrance to the exit!  There is a fireplace in the outdoor seated entrance and so many different types of dining options (from large group - loft area, to cozy little hide-aways for two)...  The food was fabulous, the waitresses are friendly and the chefs are interactive and will come out of the kitchen to greet you and receive feedback.  The salsbury steak soup was seasoned to perfection and the pasta with mushrooms, wine sauce, artichoke and grilled chicken was wonderful and enough food for two days (at least - could have stretched it to three).  We are looking forward to going back for a Happy Hour and with a large group because it's a really nice gathering spot!!!  Oh, and how could I possibly forget the desert?  It was absolutely, positively the best pan of chocolate chip cookie with ice cream and whipped cream that I have ever had - definitely enough for two - YUM!

data.title: Good place for lunch
data.text: I had an excellent lobster salad.  The service was friendly and fast.  Reasonable prices.

data.title: Nice outdoor seating
data.text: The outdoor seating is great for enjoying the people watching and nice weather.  The service can be hit or miss.  Good place for drinks.  They have some good menu choices too.  Be aware that it starts to get "clubby" at about 9 on weekends.  The music can be loud if you are trying to hold on a conversation.
